cab.content: SECRET. Copy No. 9^December 24, 1940. \/TO BE KEPT UNDER LOCK AND KEY.It is requested that special care may be taken toensure the secrecy of this document.WAR CABINET.100 OCTANE FUEL PLANTS AT HEYSFfAM AND THORNTON.Memorandum by the Minister of Aircraft Production.I DESIRE the authority of the Cabinet to transfer the 100 octane fuel plantsat Heysham and Thornton to the Ministry of Works and Buildings.These plants are entirely outside the proper scope of the Ministry of aircraft production. We are not responsible for the supply of fuel to the Air Ministry.The technical sub-committee dealing with Heysham consists of repre-sentatives of three oil concerns and officials from this Department. It waspresided over by Air Vice-Marshal Tedder, who is no longer in this Ministry.The appointment of a new chairman is necessary. We have no one suitablehere.The Minister of Works and Buildings has been consulted about the transferof responsibility which I now propose. He is ready to take it over.B.Ministry of Aircraft Production,December 24, 1940.22053 j"" " . 112Printed for the War Cabinet. December 1940.
